metadata.title: CVE-2019-13134 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
ImageMagick before 7.0.8-50 has a memory leak vulnerability in the functionReadVIFFImage in coders/viff.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13134` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3').
